notes: Three field experiments testing whether thank-you calls increase charitable giving. The paper's main analysis (Table 2) uses nonparametric tests (Wilcoxon rank-sum, chi-square) for difference-in-means. Table A1 provides OLS/FE regressions with controls. We focus on Experiment 1 (public TV stations) as the primary baseline group since it is the largest, best-powered experiment with the richest covariate set. Experiment 2 (national non-profit) is a separate baseline group with a distinct population and no demographic controls available. Experiment 3 is treated as exploration (it tests a modified script variant, not a simple thank-you call effect).

baseline_groups.label: Thank-you call -> Donation behavior, Experiment 1 (Public TV Stations)

design_audit.se_type: nonparametric (ranksum/chi2 for Table 2), classical OLS SE for Table A1 (xtreg, fe without robust/cluster option)
design_audit.sample_filter: exp1_analysis_data (exec_date != 1610, 1701; stations 24, 55, 64, 61 dropped; payment_amount2==0 dropped; sustaining donors dropped; big donors >=10k dropped)
design_audit.notes: Individual-level randomization within station x quarter strata. Table 2 reports treatment vs control means with Wilcoxon rank-sum p-values (continuous) and chi-square p-values (binary). Table A1 reports OLS with strata FE (xtreg, fe) and demographic controls. Note: xtreg, fe without robust option uses classical (non-robust) SE.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Charitable donation behavior in the year following the thank-you call: whether the donor renewed (binary), and the amount donated (continuous)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Thank-you phone call to existing donors (treat=1 vs control=0)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) average effect of being assigned to receive a thank-you call on donation outcomes
claim_object.target_population: Existing donors at public television stations who donated in the year before the experiment (excluding sustaining donors and big donors >=10k)

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp1-PercentDonating
baseline_specs.notes: Binary outcome: whether donor renewed. Chi-square test of independence.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp1-AmountDonated
baseline_specs.notes: Continuous outcome: total gift amount (includes 0 for non-donors). Wilcoxon rank-sum test.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp1-NumberOfGifts
baseline_specs.notes: Count outcome: number of gifts in year after. Wilcoxon rank-sum test.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp1-AmountCondDonating
baseline_specs.notes: Continuous outcome: gift amount conditional on donating (renewing==1). Wilcoxon rank-sum test. Conditional sample.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp1-RetentionRate
baseline_specs.notes: Continuous outcome: retention rate = payment_amount3/payment_amount2. Wilcoxon rank-sum test.

baseline_specs.label: TableA1-Exp1-Donated-OLS
baseline_specs.notes: OLS (xtreg, fe) with strata FE and demographic controls. Table A1 Col 1.

baseline_specs.label: TableA1-Exp1-GiftCondDonated-OLS
baseline_specs.notes: OLS (xtreg, fe) with strata FE and demographic controls. Table A1 Col 4. Conditional on donating.

constraints.notes: Baseline Table 2 uses 0 controls (pure difference-in-means). Table A1 uses 9 controls (2 baseline giving + 7 demographic). Range spans both. Controls: payment_amount2 (baseline gift), var12 (baseline num gifts), female, age_display2, age_display3, inc_display3, inc_display1, inc_display2, lor_display2.

rc_notes.rc/controls/loo/*: Leave-one-out from the Table A1 full control set (9 controls). Run only for the OLS baseline specs (donated and gift_cond with controls).
rc_notes.rc/controls/sets/none: No controls, no FE. Pure difference-in-means as in Table 2.
rc_notes.rc/controls/sets/baseline_giving_only: Only baseline giving controls (payment_amount2, var12) plus strata FE. Midpoint between Table 2 and Table A1.
rc_notes.rc/controls/sets/demographics_only: Only demographic controls (female, age, income, residence length dummies) plus strata FE.
rc_notes.rc/controls/sets/full_with_fe: All 9 controls plus strata FE, replicating Table A1.
rc_notes.rc/sample/outliers/trim_y_1_99: Trim top 1% of outcome distribution. Apply only to continuous monetary outcomes (payment_amount3, gift_cond, retention), not binary (renewing, donated).
rc_notes.rc/sample/outliers/trim_y_5_95: Trim top 5% of outcome distribution. Same restriction as trim_1_99.
rc_notes.rc/sample/quality/drop_big_donors_5k: Drop donors with any single gift >= $5,000 (paper already drops >= $10,000). Stricter threshold as robustness.
rc_notes.rc/sample/quality/include_sustaining_don: Include sustaining donors that were dropped in data preparation (step1, line 369). Tests sensitivity to this exclusion. Requires re-running data construction pipeline from step1 without the sustaining_donors drop.
rc_notes.rc/sample/quality/drop_stations_with_few: Drop station x quarter strata with fewer than 10 observations in either treatment or control arm.
rc_notes.rc/form/outcome/asinh: Apply inverse hyperbolic sine transform to continuous monetary outcomes (payment_amount3, gift_cond). NOT to binary outcomes (renewing, donated). Interpretation: coefficient gives approximate semi-elasticity for large y; preserves outcome concept as level effect up to monotone transform. Binary treatment makes the coefficient still directly interpretable as transformed-unit treatment effect.
rc_notes.rc/form/outcome/log1p: Apply log(1+y) transform to continuous monetary outcomes. Same restriction as asinh. Interpretation: coefficient gives approximate percent change for small effects; handles zeros via +1 offset.
rc_notes.rc/fe/strata/station_only: Use station FE only (instead of station x exec_date strata FE). For OLS specs only.
rc_notes.rc/fe/strata/none: Drop strata FE entirely. For OLS specs only.

canonical.notes: For difference-in-means specs, use Wilcoxon rank-sum (continuous) or chi-square (binary) matching the paper's Table 2 approach. For OLS specs, use classical (non-robust) standard errors matching Stata xtreg, fe default (no robust/cluster option specified in paper code).

variants.notes: Heteroskedasticity-robust (HC1) standard errors for OLS regression specs.
Cluster at station level (higher than strata) as a stress test. Relevant because randomization was within station x quarter, but outcomes may be correlated within station.
Simple two-sample t-test as alternative to rank-sum for difference-in-means specs.

budgets.notes: 7 baseline specs. For focal outcomes (renewing, payment_amount3, donated), run 3 design + 13 rc (controls) + 5 rc (sample) + 2 rc (form) + 2 rc (FE) = 25 RC per focal, but many are conditional on OLS vs diff-in-means. Budget set at 80 to allow headroom.

sampling.notes: Full enumeration is feasible; no sampling needed. Control pool is small (9 controls total).

diagnostics_plan.notes: Balance test for pre-treatment covariates between treatment and control. Replicates Table 1 Experiment 1.
Test whether attrition/missing data differs by treatment status.

baseline_groups.label: Thank-you call -> Donation behavior, Experiment 2 (National Non-Profit)

design_audit.sample_filter: exp2_analysis_data (gift.dta source; existing donors dropped via payment_amount1!=.; baseline non-donors with payment_amount2==0 kept since replaced to 0 if missing)
design_audit.notes: Individual-level randomization with no strata. Table 2 reports treatment vs control means with Wilcoxon rank-sum p-values (continuous) and chi-square p-values (binary). Table A1 reports OLS without FE and without demographic controls (only baseline giving vars).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Charitable donation behavior in the year following the thank-you call at a national non-profit
claim_object.treatment_concept: Thank-you phone call to existing donors (treat=1 vs control=0)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) average effect of being assigned to receive a thank-you call on donation outcomes
claim_object.target_population: Existing donors at a national non-profit organization

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp2-PercentDonating
baseline_specs.notes: Binary outcome: whether donor renewed. Chi-square test.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp2-AmountDonated
baseline_specs.notes: Continuous outcome: total gift amount. Wilcoxon rank-sum test.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp2-NumberOfGifts
baseline_specs.notes: Count outcome: number of gifts. Wilcoxon rank-sum test.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp2-AmountCondDonating
baseline_specs.notes: Continuous outcome: gift amount conditional on donating. Wilcoxon rank-sum.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Exp2-RetentionRate
baseline_specs.notes: Continuous outcome: retention rate. Wilcoxon rank-sum.

baseline_specs.label: TableA1-Exp2-Donated-OLS
baseline_specs.notes: OLS regression with only baseline giving controls. No demographic controls available for Exp 2. No FE (no strata). Table A1 Col 2.

baseline_specs.label: TableA1-Exp2-GiftCondDonated-OLS
baseline_specs.notes: OLS regression with baseline giving controls. Table A1 Col 5. Conditional on donating.

constraints.notes: Experiment 2 has no demographic covariates. Only baseline giving controls available: payment_amount2, var12. Range: 0 (Table 2 diff-in-means) to 2 (Table A1 OLS).

rc_notes.rc/controls/loo/*: Leave-one-out from the 2 baseline giving controls. Run for OLS specs only.
rc_notes.rc/controls/sets/none: No controls. Pure difference-in-means as in Table 2.
rc_notes.rc/controls/sets/baseline_giving_only: Both baseline giving controls (payment_amount2, var12). Replicates Table A1.
rc_notes.rc/sample/outliers/trim_y_1_99: Trim top 1% of continuous outcomes only.
rc_notes.rc/sample/outliers/trim_y_5_95: Trim top 5% of continuous outcomes only.
rc_notes.rc/form/outcome/asinh: Inverse hyperbolic sine for continuous monetary outcomes only. Interpretation: approximate semi-elasticity for large y.
rc_notes.rc/form/outcome/log1p: Log(1+y) for continuous monetary outcomes only. Interpretation: approximate percent change for small effects.

canonical.notes: Wilcoxon rank-sum (continuous) or chi-square (binary) for diff-in-means specs. Classical OLS SE for regression specs (Stata reg without robust option). Matches paper.

variants.notes: HC1 robust SE for OLS specs.

budgets.notes: 7 baseline specs. Smaller RC space than G1 due to fewer available controls and no FE variation. Budget at 40.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Balance test on pre-treatment giving variables. Replicates Table 1 Experiment 2.

focal_outcomes.G1_notes: Whether the donor renewed (percent donating) is the paper's primary outcome of interest across all three experiments. It appears first in Table 2 and is the focus of Figures 1-3.
focal_outcomes.G1_secondary_notes: Total gift amount (unconditional) is the secondary continuous outcome.

available_covariates.notes: Experiment 1 has 9 controls (2 baseline giving + 7 demographics). Missing indicators (female_missing, age_income_missing) are available but not used in the paper's main regressions. Experiment 2 has only 2 baseline giving controls. Experiment 3 adds new_script dummy but is treated as exploration.

experiment_3.reason: Experiment 3 tests a modified thank-you call script (new_script) in addition to the original script. This is a different treatment concept (new vs original script) compared to G1/G2 (any call vs no call). Treated as exploration.
experiment_3.tables: Table 2 Panel C, Table A1 Cols 3 and 6

LATE_estimates.reason: Table A2 presents IV/LATE estimates instrumenting 'reached' with 'treat'. This changes the estimand from ITT to LATE (effect of actually being reached). Treated as exploration.

future_years.reason: Table A3 examines treatment effects 2-5 years after randomization. This changes the outcome timing concept. Treated as exploration.

unconditional_gift_amount.reason: Table A4 runs OLS on unconditional gift amount (payment_amount3) for Exp 1. This is already represented in G1 baseline specs as a diff-in-means and could be run as an RC variant (OLS with controls). Included implicitly via rc/controls/sets/full_with_fe on payment_amount3.

interaction_effects.reason: Table A6 tests treatment interactions with pledge drive, gender, age, income, etc. These are heterogeneity analyses, not baseline estimand-preserving. Treated as exploration.

expert_forecasts.reason: Figures 2-3 and Table A5 concern expert forecast accuracy, not the experimental treatment effect itself.
